def priority(item: float, bins: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """Returns priority with which we want to add item to each bin.

    Args:
        item: Size of item to be added to the bin.
        bins: Array of capacities for each bin.

    Return:
        Array of same size as bins with priority score of each bin.
    """
    """Advanced version of priority function."""

    priorities = np.zeros_like(bins)

    if item < 0:
        raise ValueError("Item size cannot be negative")

    max_bin_capacity = np.max(bins)
    total_bins = len(bins)

    for i in range(total_bins):
        if bins[i] <= 0:
            priorities[i] = np.nan 
        else:
            remaining_capacity_ratio = (bins[i] / max_bin_capacity)
            capacity_utilization = (max_bin_capacity - bins[i]) / max_bin_capacity
            item_ratio = item / max_bin_capacity

            if item <= bins[i]:
                priority_score = item_ratio * (1 + capacity_utilization + remaining_capacity_ratio)
                if bins[i] < 0.3 * max_bin_capacity:
                    priority_score *= 1.6
                elif bins[i] > 0.7 * max_bin_capacity:
                    priority_score *= 0.8
                priorities[i] = priority_score
            else:
                overflow_factor = (item - bins[i]) / total_bins
                priority_score = overflow_factor * (max_bin_capacity / (bins[i] + 1)) * remaining_capacity_ratio * (1 - capacity_utilization)
                if overflow_factor > 0.5:
                    priority_score *= 1.9
                elif overflow_factor < 0.2:
                    priority_score *= 0.7
                priorities[i] = priority_score

    return priorities
